intro: Lasiocephalus puracensis, commonly known as the Peruvian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its stem is erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
